definitions.definition: the measurement or extent of something from end to end; the greater of two or the greatest of three dimensions of a body.
examples: it can reach over two feet in length
synonyms: scope "a length of three or four yards"

definitions.definition: the amount of time occupied by something.
examples: delivery must be within a reasonable length of time
the length of the waiting list
synonyms: long-windedness "the press criticized the length of her speech"

definitions.definition: the full distance that a thing extends for.
examples: the muscles running the length of my spine

definitions.definition: the extent of a garment in a vertical direction when worn.
the metrical quantity or duration of a vowel or syllable.
the extent of something, especially as a unit of measurement, in particular.
the length of a swimming pool as a measure of the distance swum.
the length of a horse, boat, etc., as a measure of the lead in a race.
examples: the mare won the race last year by seven lengths

definitions.definition: the full extent of one's body.
examples: noun: one's length; plural noun: one's lengths

definitions.definition: (in bridge or whist) the number of cards of a suit held in one's hand, especially when five or more.
a stretch or piece of something.
a degree or extreme to which a course of action is taken.
examples: they go to great lengths to avoid the press
